wikipedia_page.main: Richard Dagley (c.1761–1841) was an English subject painter and illustrator.

response: He died on 17 December 1834, not without complaining of the neglect with which he had latterly been treated. He is said to have been "a man of unaffected modesty and generosity; friendship and integrity adorned his private life". Francis Chantrey carved a bust of him, and John Opie, John Jackson, and George Harlow all painted his portrait. Richard Dagley was a friend.

link_mentions.page: List of people educated at Christ's Hospital

response: Elizabeth Frances Dagley (1788–1853), sometimes publishing under her initials as E.F.D., was a Regency Era author of children's literature. She was the daughter of the artist and educator Richard Dagley.L.A. Fagan, "Dagley, Richard (1761–1841)", revised by Katherine Coombs. Oxford Dictionary of National Biography (online ed.). Oxford University Press, 2002. Her writing, although for children, "articulates the problems and misery of economic insecurity".Rebecca-Anne C. Do Rozario, Fashion in the Fairy Tale Tradition (Palgrave Macmillan, 2018), pp. 146-148.
* Takings, or the Life of a Collegian, with 26 Etchings by Richard Dagley, 1821, 8vo.
* Richard Dagley (c. 1761–1841), English painter and illustrator
